symptoms.name: Painful rash
symptoms.severity: Variable, can be severe during first outbreak
symptoms.pattern: Develops in genital area, often in clusters of small blisters that can tear open and weep, forming scabs as they heal; may also itch or burn

symptoms.name: Fever
symptoms.severity: Mild to moderate, more common during first outbreak

symptoms.name: Headache
symptoms.severity: Mild to moderate, more common during first outbreak

symptoms.name: General exhaustion
symptoms.severity: Mild to moderate, more common during first outbreak

symptoms.name: Muscle pain
symptoms.severity: Mild to moderate, more common during first outbreak

symptoms.name: Swollen lymph nodes in groin
symptoms.severity: Mild to moderate, more common during first outbreak

symptoms.name: Pain in bottom, hips, or legs
Ulcers and blisters on the inside of the back passage
Small red or itchy area with one or two blisters

physical_findings: Small, painful blisters around the genitals

lab_values.Herpes virus test: Positive for herpes simplex virus (HSV-1 or HSV-2)

required: Positive herpes virus test from a sample of cells from the affected area
